Services > uiThumbnailGenerator

Thumbnail Generator

Using the thumbnail generator factory, you can create thumnbail images of existing images or DOM elements. The thumbnailed image will be sampled to create a higher quality image than simply resizing. In order to use it please do the following:
Include uiThumbnailGenerator as a dependency in your app module 

var module = angular.module('myModule', ['uiThumbnailGenerator']);
For generating a thumbnail from a DOM element, use the generateFromHtml method with the following signature: 

/**
* Generates a thumbnail image from the supplied html element with the required width and height.  The html
* element is converted into a canvas object before then being converted to a thumbnail.
* @param htmlElement the html element to be thumbnail-ed
* @param maxHeight the maximum height of the generated thumbnail.
* @param maxWidth the maximum width of the generated thumbnail.
* @param callback the callback function to be applied upon successful generation.  This callback function will
* be supplied with a blob representation of the image as well as an image url object.
*/
generateFromHtml: function(htmlElement, maxHeight, maxWidth, callback) {
}
With the following as an example of it's use: 

uiThumbnailGenerator.generateFromHtml(document.getElementById(’someId’), 250, 250, function(thumbnailImageBlob, thumbnailImage) {
// do something with the returned blob and image.
});
For generating a thumbnail from an image, use the generateFromImage method with the following signature: 

/**
 * Generates a thumbnail image from the supplied image object with the required width and height.
 * @param imageObject the object containing the image to be thumbnail-ed.  Can be either an image file or a data url.
 * @param maxHeight the maximum height of the generated thumbnail.
 * @param maxWidth the maximum width of the generated thumbnail.
 * @param callback the callback function to be applied upon successful generation.  This callback function will
 * be supplied with a blob representation of the image as well as an image url object.
 * @param quality of the image: 0 - basic, 1 - Box filter, 2 - Hamming filter, 3 - Lanczos filter (window 2.0px) 4 - Lanczos filter (window 3.0px)
 * @param generateBlob boolean whether generate the blob version of the image or not
 * @param backgroundColor set the background color of the thumbnail, default is black
 */
generateFromImage: function(file, maxHeight, maxWidth, callback, backgroundColor) {
}
With the following as an example of it's use: 

uiThumbnailGenerator.generateFromImage(file, 250, 250, function(thumbnailImageBlob, thumbnailImage) {
// do something with the returned blob and image.
});
